text: I ve been busy with consensus stuff recently so got a little bit distracted. do we have a proposal or a final plan for the repo separation? Ok I know that membersrvc will be a different repo and the SDKs but the other parts?
i still think the shims are a good candidate
<@U0PB67X4K> i assume you mean the protos?

we still have  the problem, at least on golang, where “<http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim|github.com/hyperledger/fabric/core/chaincode/shim>” isn’t a well behaved coordinate for the package
I would like to see this addressed, if at all possible
well technically I actually just meant the interfaces themselves - to write chaincode, you just need to match the correct interface
but I am fine with taking the whole package as well
i have to step away, i am not sure I fully understand how that would work but would like to discuss
i am more wondering about the build mechanics of a chaincode application
for that, I would assume full coordinate resolution is required
but I might be not fully grasping what you are proposing
the interfaces are good but we should convince the others that we can solve the package management problems
